content:
The words 'valid' and 'invalid' are poorly chosen and confusing.
In fast mode you read the statement diagonally, so for example I just read 'Valid or Invalid' in first line, jump to the condition in second line and expected it to be the valid condition (and it makes more sens that way).
Then I checked the example and it didn't make sense, I went back to the statement and there was no explained example, and had to scroll trhough everything to find it in the Output section and finally understood.
It took me more than 2min to understand then 15 sec to code while with a better overall presentation it would have taken a total of 30 sec.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice a easy clash :)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fun and appropriate for challenges
Maybe a bit of changes needed to goal translation but fair enough to understand it

Really like the suggestion, quick and easy to understand! 

Although the wording is strange in places for example I think:
"Next n lines: String with numbers to be checked if each of them could be valid solution." should be something like:
"Next n lines: Strings of digits to be compared with cow"

and
"Input is valid if cow and input have not the same digit on the same places eg.:" should be:
"The input is valid if cow and the input does not have the same digit in the same place eg.:"

I would suggest proofreading the description an extra time!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's a fun, quick to solve puzzle.
The Instructions are clear enough to solve the puzzle without questions.
The chosen Gamemods are suited for the puzzle.

The Goal part in the statement is poorly written and I could not understand it (I'm not familiar with that game). Also, on Clash of Code, it's preferred to not put links because this mode is on time. Please try to make the statement clearer.
You don't explain anywhere, what constitutes "Valid" and "Invalid" inputs. (I can work this out by looking at the test cases or your solution, but it should be specified in the goal and/or output)
You were right. I added some explanation in Output part.

What words would you suggest instead?

BTW. it's been 2 years and I could swear that I see this puzzle first time, not event considering it may be mine.

Thanks for your quick answer. I think you should put the sentence that is in the output section "...is Valid if cows and the input does not have the same digit in the same place eg.:
123 and 312 are Valid
123 and 321 are Invalid" directly in the statement to replace "...is Invalid if there is the same digit in cows number and the given number on the same position (with the same index)."
Yes, It is better now, I can understand what I should do which is great.
